div1.head: Report on Walter Reed, by the Assistant Adjutant General, January 22, 1903
div1.p: STATEMENT OF THE MILITARY SERVICE OF
The United States Army, complied from the records of this [unclear]

row.cell: [unclear] appointed assistant surgeon, with rank of 1st Lieut., to rank from
Promoted to be assistant surgeon with the rank of Captain,
Promoted to be surgeon with the rank of Major,

div1.p:
He was on temporary duty at Willets Point, New York Harbor, from July, 1875
to April 1876; at Fort Yuma California, to August, 1876; Post Surgeon at Camp Lowell,
Arizona Territory, August, 1876 to August, 1877; at Fort Apache, Arizona Territory,
to May, 1880; awaiting orders and on leave of absence to October, 1880; Post Surgeon
at Fort Ontario, New York, October, 1880 to February, 1881; on duty at Fort McHenry,
Maryland, February to May, 1881; at Washington Barracks D. C., to June, 1882; Post
Surgeon at Gaithersburg, Maryland, June to November, 1882: Attending Surgeon at Head-
quarters, Department of the Platte, to June, 1883; on duty at Fort Omaha, Nebraska, to
September, 1883; Post Surgeon at Fort Sidney, Nebraska, October, 1883 to August, 1884;
at Fort Robinson, Nebraska, to August, 1887; at Mount Vernon Barracks, Alabama, to
October, 1890 (was sick from June 28 to July 4, 1890); Attending Surgeon and Examiner
of Recruits at Baltimore, Maryland, from October, 1890 to October, 1891 (excepting
while on field service at Fort Keogh, Montana, December, 1890 to January, 1891); on
duty at Fort Snelling, Montana, November, 1891 to August, 1892; Attending Surgeon and
Examiner of Recruits at Headquarters, Department of Dakota, August, 1892 to August,
1893; and on duty in Surgeon General's Office, Washington, D. C., and a Member of the
Faculty of the Army Medical School, to the date of his death.
He made various trips to Cuba on special service during 1890 and 1900.
He was sick from November 17 to November 23, 1902, the date of his death.
